page.title: 10TO AND FROM LAUGHARNE
page.content: Many children attend school by bus and many people use the bus to go to work and shop in Carmarthen. Regular coach trips are made to places of interest at reasonable prices. Cars are the main form of transport for all pur- poses, some families owning 2 or more. Railway branch line at Whitland (7 miles) and main line at Carmarthen (15 miles). Carmarthen-London takes about 4 hours, the return fare being from Â£17 (special times) to Â£40 (ordinary). Fast long-distance coaches from St Clears and Carmarthen. Dylan Thomas lived in Laugharne for a few years and is buried here. Due to his writings, especially his radio play "Under Milk Wood", the media have taken a special interest in Laugharne. Writers Richard Hughes, Charles Morgan, Hilda Vaughan also lived here.
